0.user_question: Sam had 10 socks. If he threw away 3 old ones that didn't fit and bought 36 new ones, how many socks would he have?

ost_step.1: Find out how many socks Sam had after throwing away the old socks. To do this, we need to subtract the old socks (3) from his initial sock count (10). So, 10 - 3 = 7.
ost_step.2: Add the new socks Sam bought to the remaining socks to find out how many socks he would have in total. This means adding 7 socks to the 36 new ones, giving us 7 + 36 = 43 socks.
